byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and ALAN FEUER

abstract: New York City's Conflicts of Interest Board fines Brooklyn District Atty Ken Thompson $15,000 for misallocating funds from his office to pay for meals; sanction is among largest in decade and first against district attorney since board was created in 1990.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Thompson used police officers to get his meals and pay for them before being reimbursed with office funds, said the Conflicts of Interest Board, which levied a $15,000 penalty.
snippet: Mr. Thompson used police officers to get his meals and pay for them before being reimbursed with office funds, said the Conflicts of Interest Board, which levied a $15,000 penalty....

headline.main: Ken Thompson, Brooklyn District Attorney, Is Fined for Misusing Funds on Meals
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn District Attorney Is Fined $15,000 for Misusing Funds on Meals
